CHAT.comment: younger Bro in background is very loud. At first he is reading <The Very Hungry Caterpillar> and then he draws a picture. He often tries to get Mot's attention but Mot for the most part ignores him. Bro is usually not transcribed since it is irrelevant talk
Dear SAnta PLeaSe SenD me some ToyS Michael CM

this is one of few letters where Mot does part of the writing. the letter is all written on the left side of the paper except for Chi's name and initials. The whole letter is Mot's idea and she dictates most of the spelling to him as well. Chi's younger brother is extremely distracting in the background. Chi is very into markers and uses a white marker to change some of the colors. Chi is more interested in the colors and lines (underlining the words) than the letter itself; however , at the end he writes part of his last name enthusiastically and on his own; according to the context notes , first Chi draws lines on the paper , then Mot begins writing the text <dear Santa> , then she dictates the rest of the text to him , then he underlines everything; he is not asked to read the letter back

u.a: the Boston Globe accepts letters from low-income kids and tries to give them toys they ask for; or something like that !
BRO talking and calling for Mot
somewhere around here Chi lays his head on the table
I think Bro screaming in Spanish as well as English
sometime around now Bro lies in Mot's lap
Chi crosses out b and writes uppercase p
traces the letter in the air
EXP gives Bro paper to keep him quiet , nice try
Fleetwood Mac in the background on tv: yes , it is right around Election Day 1992!
refers to the line under send instead of next to send
MOT crosses out Chi's effort and writes me herself
traces y with her finger on paper
points to letter chart on notepad
channel 4 news update in background; president-elect Clinton is thinking about his cabinet
BRO talks on while Chi writes; he's underlining rather than signing the letter
for example , the bottom part of the y in toys is obscured by Chi's underlining
reading where Chi wrote his name
Chi starting to write part of last name
